Project Structure

Understanding unify's project structure conventions is key to building maintainable static sites. unify follows a flexible, convention-over-configuration approach that scales from simple personal sites to complex multi-site deployments.

ğŸ—ï¸ Core Principle

unify uses DOM Cascade for composition - layouts and components expose public areas via CSS classes, and pages target these areas for content placement.

Directory Conventions

Source Directory (src/)

The source directory contains all your site's source files. This is where you author content and organize your project structure.

Pages

HTML and Markdown files in the root of src/ become pages:

Fragments Directory (_includes/)

The _includes/ directory contains reusable fragments, layouts, and components:

  • Layouts: Files starting with _ or ending with .layout.html
  • Fragments: Reusable HTML components
  • Partials: Content snippets for inclusion

Layout Discovery

unify provides multiple ways to discover and apply layouts, following a precedence order:

1. Explicit Layout Reference

Use data-unify attribute to specify a layout directly:

html
<!-- In your page -->
<body data-unify="/_includes/_blog.layout.html">
  <main class="unify-content">
    <h1>Blog Post Title</h1>
    <p>Content goes here...</p>
  </main>
</body>

2. Automatic Layout Discovery

Place _layout.html files in directories to automatically apply them:

text
src/
â”œâ”€â”€ _layout.html          # Applied to all pages
â”œâ”€â”€ blog/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ _layout.html      # Applied to blog pages only
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.html        # Uses blog/_layout.html
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ post-1.md         # Uses blog/_layout.html
â””â”€â”€ docs/
    â”œâ”€â”€ _layout.html      # Applied to docs pages only
    â””â”€â”€ guide.html        # Uses docs/_layout.html

3. Short Name Layouts

Reference layouts by short names for cleaner syntax:

html
<!-- _includes/_article.layout.html can be referenced as "article" -->
<body data-unify="article">
  <!-- Page content -->
</body>

File Naming Conventions

Layouts

  • _layout.html - Default layout for directory
  • _[name].layout.html - Named layouts (e.g., _blog.layout.html)
  • [name].layout.html - Alternative naming

Fragments and Components

  • [name].html - Standard HTML fragments
  • _[name].html - Private/internal fragments
  • [name].component.html - Explicit component designation

Pages

  • [name].html - HTML pages
  • [name].md - Markdown pages
  • index.html - Directory index pages

DOM Cascade Architecture

unify's DOM Cascade system provides predictable composition rules:

Public Areas

Layouts and components expose content areas via CSS classes:

html
<!-- Layout with public areas -->
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <style data-unify-docs="v1">
    /* Public areas - document the contract */
    .unify-header { /* Site header area */ }
    .unify-content { /* Main content area */ }
    .unify-sidebar { /* Optional sidebar */ }
    .unify-footer { /* Site footer area */ }
  </style>
</head>
<body>
  <header class="unify-header">
    <h1>Default Site Title</h1>
  </header>
  
  <main class="unify-content">
    <p>Default content</p>
  </main>
  
  <aside class="unify-sidebar">
    <p>Default sidebar</p>
  </aside>
  
  <footer class="unify-footer">
    <p>Â© 2024 Default Footer</p>
  </footer>
</body>
</html>

Page Targeting

Pages target layout areas by using matching class names:

html
<body data-unify="/_includes/_layout.html">
  <header class="unify-header">
    <h1>My Custom Page Title</h1>
    <nav>
      <a href="/">Home</a>
      <a href="/about">About</a>
    </nav>
  </header>
  
  <main class="unify-content">
    <h2>Page Content</h2>
    <p>This replaces the default content.</p>
  </main>
  
  <!-- unify-sidebar not provided, uses layout default -->
  <!-- unify-footer not provided, uses layout default -->
</body>

Configuration Options

Customize project structure via unify.config.yaml:

yaml
# unify.config.yaml
source: src                 # Source directory
output: dist               # Output directory  
clean: true                # Clean output before build

# Custom paths
includes: _components      # Custom fragments directory
assets: static            # Custom assets directory

# Build options
pretty-urls: true         # Generate pretty URLs
minify: false            # Minify HTML output
verbose: false           # Verbose build logging

# Development server
port: 3000               # Dev server port
host: localhost          # Dev server host
ğŸ¯ Best Practices
  • Keep it simple: Start with basic structure, add complexity as needed
  • Use clear naming: Make file purposes obvious from their names
  • Document public areas: Always use data-unify-docs blocks in layouts
  • Organize by feature: Group related components and layouts together
  • Leverage conventions: Use automatic layout discovery for cleaner code
